title: Sechaba's scathing attack on music bosses: 'You only think about us when we are dead'
text:
WATCH: Hlaudi gate-crashes Lundi Tyamara's memorial to sing his own praises 
A fuming Sechaba had to be calmed down as he gave an emotional address at Lundi Tymara's memorial at Grace Bible Church in Soweto on Tuesday. 
The Eloyi hitmaker told mourners that the music industry was exploiting artists, pushing many to drugs and alcohol. 
"They say we smoke drugs and drink. Yes, we do that because we are frustrated," Sechaba said. 
Sechaba said the music industry neglected its stars and left Lundi without food. 
"Lundi would attend events and make everyone cry and then when he is done he would go home and cry to himself, because there was no food in the fridge. 
"Why are people crying? What makes them cry? Where were you when Lundi was in hospital? You heard that he was eating through a drip," Sechaba said. South Africa is to blame for breaking Lundi, says close friend 
An angry Sechaba then turned his attention to other gospel artists in attendance, asking who was taking care of the widows and children of dead gospel singers such as Sfiso Ncwane, Vuyo Mokoena and Oleseng Shuping. 
"Since Vuyo died how many of you went to visit his wife? How many of you visited Oleseng's wife? You don't even know where she lives," Sechaba said. 
His address had mourners on their feet as they clapped and cheered at his remarks. 
His microphone was cut near the end of his address and he stormed off the stage. Share
